QAPair.Question: What is (are) Hemodialysis access - self care ?
QAPair.Answer: Vascular access (often called just "access") is needed for you to get hemodialysis . Using the access, blood is removed from your body, cleaned by a dialyzer, then returned to your body. Usually the access is put in a person's arm. But it can also go in your leg. Depending on the type of access, it takes a few weeks to a few months to get an access ready for hemodialysis. Taking good care of your access helps make it last longer.

QAPair.Question: How to prevent Hemodialysis access - self care ?

Question.qtype: when to contact a medical professional

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for Hemodialysis access - self care ?
